title: Typophile Widget?
content:
Can we get a Typophile Widget for Mac OS X’s Dashboard? Would that not just totally rock? How much effort is needed to program a widget?

 [‹ LiveType Project new name - help!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071735/http:/typophile.com/node/14326 "Go to previous forum topic") [LinkLetter ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071735/http:/typophile.com/node/14304 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dan_reynolds

comments.content:
I’ve got 2 of these in the works at the current time. Both are fully functional but need a little design refinement.

1. Smalltalk generator. Remember this one? It spews out pretentious things to say at type conferences. I was hoping to release this before/at TypeCon but ended up being too busy running to and fro to get it out there.

2. Typophile RSS reader. This aggregates all feeds into one stream, but flip it over and you can set it to focus in one any particular group (General Discussions, wiki, etc)

What would be the killer widget? What does everyone want to see?
Instant messages? Is that possible?
Typowiki Widget...I already have a Wikipedia widget which is great but the Typowiki would be awesome!

I don’t know anything about programming, but would kill me would be an RSS-reader type thing that showed which threads had just gotten comments.

Basically, the Typophile tracker page:  
 [http://typophile.com/tracker](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071735/http:/typophile.com/tracker "http://typophile.com/tracker")

Then I wouldn’t have to keep refreshing my browser…
